intro: Eriocaulon dicline, commonly known as the zigzag sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a distinct zigzag pattern along their edges. Eriocaulon dicline plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
